fiveKeys.title: 5 Keys to Food Safety
fiveKeys.subtitle: Essential steps to keep your food safe

clean.title: Keep Clean
clean.description: Wash hands with soap and running water before preparing food
tips: Protect food from insects and animals

separate.title: Separate Raw & Cooked
separate.description: Keep raw food separate from cooked food
tips: Use different cutting boards for meat and vegetables
Store raw meat at the bottom of the fridge
Use sealed containers for each type of food

cook.title: Cook Thoroughly
cook.description: Cook food at the right temperature to kill germs
tips: Ensure meat is cooked all the way through
Boil soups and gravies until bubbling

temperature.title: Keep at Safe Temperatures
temperature.description: Don't leave food at room temperature for too long
tips: Don't leave food out for more than 2 hours

safe.title: Use Safe Ingredients
safe.description: Choose fresh ingredients and clean water
tips: Choose fresh food that hasn't expired
Avoid unpasteurized milk and dairy products

moderate.title: Moderate Symptoms

highRiskFoods.title: High-Risk Foods
highRiskFoods.subtitle: Foods that require special handling to prevent food poisoning

meat.title: Raw Meat & Poultry
meat.description: Raw or undercooked meat and poultry can contain harmful bacteria like Salmonella and E. coli.
meat.prevention: Cook thoroughly to safe internal temperatures.

seafood.title: Seafood & Shellfish
seafood.description: Raw fish and shellfish may carry parasites and bacteria including Vibrio.
seafood.prevention: Buy from reputable sources and keep refrigerated.

eggs.title: Raw Eggs
eggs.description: Eggs can contain Salmonella both inside and on the shell.
eggs.prevention: Cook eggs until yolks are firm. Avoid foods with raw eggs.

dairy.title: Unpasteurized Dairy
dairy.description: Raw milk and soft cheeses can contain dangerous bacteria like Listeria.
dairy.prevention: Only consume pasteurized milk and cheese products.

fridgeGame.title: Organize the Fridge
fridgeGame.subtitle: Drag and drop items to the correct shelf to ensure food safety

feedback.success: Great job! Your fridge is organized safely.

education.title: Why is this organization correct?
education.top: Top Shelf: Ready-to-eat foods like leftovers, drinks, and yogurt. They don't need cooking and won't drip on other items.
education.middle: Middle Shelf: Eggs and cooked meats. This area has a consistent temperature suitable for these items.
education.bottom: Bottom Shelf: Raw meat and fish. This is the coldest part, and placing them here prevents dangerous juices from dripping onto other food.
education.drawer: Crisper Drawer: Fruits and vegetables. It maintains humidity to keep them fresh and isolates them from raw meats.

q1.question: How long should you wash your hands with soap and water?
q1.explanation: You should wash your hands for at least 20 seconds (about the time it takes to sing 'Happy Birthday' twice) to kill germs effectively.

q2.question: Where should you store raw meat in the refrigerator?
q2.explanation: Raw meat should always go on the bottom shelf to prevent juices from dripping onto other ready-to-eat foods.

q3.question: What is the 'Danger Zone' for food temperature?
q3.explanation: Bacteria grow fastest between 5°C and 60°C. Keep hot food hot (>60°C) and cold food cold (<5°C).

q4.question: Which is the SAFEST way to thaw frozen chicken?

options.b: In a bowl of hot water

q4.explanation: Thawing in the refrigerator maintains a safe temperature. The counter or hot water allows bacteria to multiply rapidly.

q5.question: Which of these is a common symptom of food poisoning?
q5.explanation: Vomiting, diarrhea, stomach pain, and fever are the most common signs of foodborne illness.

firstAid.title: What to do while waiting?
steps: Stay hydrated: Drink small sips of water or oral rehydration solution.
Do NOT induce vomiting unless instructed by a professional.
Rest: Lay down on your side to prevent choking if vomiting occurs.
Keep a sample: If possible, keep a sample of the suspected food for testing.

emergency.severeSymptoms: Seek help immediately if you have:
symptomsList: Signs of hydration (dry mouth, little urination)

info.title: What is BeSS?
info.description: BeSS (Bersih, Selamat, Sihat) is a food safety recognition program by the Ministry of Health Malaysia. Premises with BeSS certification have met food safety and hygiene standards.
info.benefits: Look for BeSS certified premises for safer food choices.
